sourcesContent:
const NewsData = [ { 'id': 1, 'date': 'March 1, 2019', 'cover': "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/Y_Mw07i9I1qN5x-wjfoR2BXMbypo5o5Jf3SghQB68Jr6IlXukdY8BWD0nDysJmEj31AYl1YyDVAuUVKfAzZyLeuPRneS1SYcgn2X3L2JfjpJq2SoMHKXRpzCm_q20S35wn6AKtz7", 'title': 'Fantuan Rush is now available', 'content': '

Fantuan’s latest addition, Fantuan Rush, is a game-changer for its users. The new service is designed to be the helping hand you need when time is just not on your side. It is, simply put, an incredibly easy to use errand service. Users can now order a courier to pick up and drop off any item they need transported (ex: documents, flowers, electronics, pre-bought/made food, etc.) within their neighbouring cities.

In addition, Fantuan Rush’s “Help Me Buy” feature allows users to have a courier go to a store that is not partnered with the company’s food delivery service (ex: 7-Eleven, Shoppers Drug Mart, Starbucks, Best Buy, etc.), buy whatever product they wish for and have it delivered to their door.

Fantuan Rush accepts coupons, like all Fantuan services, and is currently available in both English and Mandarin throughout Fantuan’s Canadian cities: Vancouver, Victoria, Edmonton, Calgary, Toronto and Montreal.

Fantuan Rush is an excellent example of the company’s actualization of its mission: “life made easier.” This service can help ease the lives of thousands of people, offering a solution to various daily struggles brought on by one thing nobody canget enough of time.

', 'user': 'Crystal Li' }, { 'id': 2, 'date': 'January 1, 2019', 'cover': "https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/B96gV5jg-s1mg_PC2g9YhcDOPvNMBTqp_u0a2z5RkROO5N3db20RuOlIu7smYzT1FQKEBlwuN3uvqa4L9ZtcPBDba_OZ5XuVsF7veVO0TZiK4lm9QepeyreT7UilNnk1ZTE3etWW", 'title': 'Fantuan Reviews Launched in Vancouver', 'content': '

Vancouver can be described as a true food paradise - especially in regards to authentic Asian cuisine. With such a big variety of restaurants out there, it can be difficult to decide on a place to eat from. That is why Fantuan came out with its recent feature: Fantuan Reviews.

Users can view the experience of others and get a better understanding of restaurants, thereby improving their restaurant search efficiency. These reviews may provide restaurants with feedback, create a restaurant yellow page and a user information sharing platform. In the future, Fantuan also plans for this feature to offer additional services, like enable customers to make group purchases and reservations, as well as obtain electronic membership cards and more.

Yes - other local food platforms may already offer review services, but, especially in Vancouver, these services seem to insufficiently satisfy users’ needs. While Asian cuisine accounts for a large portion of Vancouver’s food scene, in areas heavily populated with Chinese or Korean people, some of the best, most authentic restaurants do not have English names. This means that these quality restaurants cannot be found on existing local platforms efficiently, or even at all. That is where Fantuan comes in with the advantage: being able to offer honest reviews of a greater portion of Vancouver’s Asian restaurants.

Although Fantuan Reviews is currently only available in Vancouver, the company plans to expand this feature to all its locations in time, with the next stop being Toronto.

', 'user': 'Crystal Li' }, { 'id': 3, 'date': 'January 14, 2019', 'cover': 'https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/k_FyBIxmwFmTcVLInNwPmKELwbXNlQG38nOmONYP8DozIA2p5NpJAM8bjC-Q1BW3tVtAEH0OfpSlUuo_hTRxaFKAY_dCY6YfcMoDAc_2xQFav4B8dTEdoYP4esXQgJlNdCdOTcP9', 'title': 'Fantuan wins Young Elite’s 2019 “YE Young Industry Leader” award', 'content': '

On November 29, 2019, the Young Elite Vancouver Business Association successfully hosted the ASPAC YE 2019 annual dinner in Vancouver. On the evening of the party, the Vancouver Young Youth Association presented awards to Vancouver’s Outstanding YoungStart-ups and Outstanding Young Entrepreneurs. The Vancouver Youth League aims to build a stage for young Vancouver entrepreneurs. More than 300 local young talents gathered in Vancouver to celebrate their growth and share their achievements overthe past year with the purpose of learning, making friends, mutual encouragement and development.

Yaofei Feng, the CTO of Fantuan, was invited to accept the “YE Young Industry Leader” award, on behalf of Fantuan, and share his personal entrepreneurial experience, along with Fantuan’s development process with the guests of this event. This award reflects the Chinese community in Vancouver’s recognition of Fantuan as the leading Chinese entrepreneurial company in Vancouver. Since its establishment in 2014, Fantuan has dug deep into the technological life-services industry and is continuing to innovate and meet the needs of consumers and businesses. The company has also been actively giving back to the community for a long time, providing overseas youth with a platform for career development in the internet industry. 

The award was created by the Vancouver Youth League in 2017. Every year in Vancouver, about 30 representatives, people or businesses from various industries are included in the candidate list. “YE Young Industry Leader” not only requires the nominated company to have a widely recognized performance and social responsibility, but also requires the candidate to have a bold vision and unique understanding and judgment of the world’s macro-structures. Those who have been selected as “YE Young Industry Leaders” need to actively serve various industries in Vancouver, have an innovative spirit and actively contribute to help create a brighter future for the local community in Vancouver.

', 'user': 'Crystal Li' }, { 'id': 4, 'date': 'December 1, 2019', 'cover': "https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/ub-zmgvekXcQMdi7gP1sJPLRZaTIgYRPMZMr3Au8G0Rb-ntq8dQlIavqpjaZJ0MBLoZs5_bvQaoKVzspzcparLtrbgHBj-TMLAn8Ovn3pHo0wr0PK_JTnLC3XXnLeCrPj26V77Yj", 'title': 'Fantuan wins EDGE Awards’ “Most Potential Investment Enterprise of the Year”', 'content': '

On the evening of December 8, 2019, Titanium Media released the final results of the 2019 EDGE Awards’ “Most Potential Investment Enterprise of the Year.” Fantuan won the title, accepting the award on-site at the Titanium Media 2019 EDGE Awards Gala Dinner.

The Titanium Media EDGE Awards focuses on business innovation and cutting-edge technology. Through screening and evaluation of over 1,000 outstanding companies and products, it reviewed and summarized key achievements in the field of scientific andtechnological innovation in the past year. 

After receiving the first round of financing in December 2018, Fantuan quickly established itself in the Canadian market and successfully entered 3 major cities in the US. Since its first stop in Seattle, its order volume has increased by 150% and the number of daily active users has maintained a growth trend of nearly 200%. In addition, Fantuan launched Fantuan Reviews (a review & coupon service), Fantuan Rush (an errand service) and other features to equip North American users with a full range of life services. Fantuan’s award selection is not only an affirmation of its achievements in the past year, but also reflects its unlimited potential in the future of scientific and technological innovation.

The Titanium Media EDGE Awards’ Global Innovation Award is an industry authority, launched by the Titanium T-EDGE Global Innovation Platform. It consists of the EDGE TOP50 list, the EDGE Awards Innovation Award and the T-EDGE Global Innovation Competition.

', 'user': 'Crystal Li' }, { 'id': 5, 'date': 'September 1, 2019', 'cover': "https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/fsH8vLvhYgbBSiiHnOsZ7_xA_lUsmPPmAzwaEnGNqlhLB0685tfsSt5IulSthxd8zRzjbp65nCE8f8E33kdlR1WONk2ZQSB7Bl0_9JXHs4HX1lfYLinZ2UmO7_oz-KIUQ-dVXToC", 'title': 'Fantuan Delivery is now operating in New York and California', 'content': '

On September 1, after a few months of testing the waters in Seattle, Fantuan Delivery launched its food delivery, self-pick up and errand services (Fantuan Rush) in two high-traffic areas of New York and California. Among both locations, the New York area was the first to open. Starting September 1st, users in Flushing, Long Island, Brooklyn and other key areas of New York can order the above services through the Fantuan app, and the platform will assign the order to be delivered by a courier in the system (excluding self-pickup orders). Meals are delivered within an hour and users can rank and review their entire delivery experience on Fantuan’s platform. 10 days after its New York launch, these services became available in the Irvine, California area.

Fantuan’s entry into the US is the most important step for its expansion over North America. Starting in Seattle, Fantuan quickly covered the main areas and accumulated a large number of users and partner merchants. Since its launch, the order volume has increased by 150% and the number of daily active users has maintained a growth trend of nearly 200%. Fantuan now covers over 100 merchants in New York and California; the list only increasing with time. Fantuan will continue to expand to different regions in California, as well as to other areas and Chinese communities within the US.

For merchants, the benefits of partnering with Fantuan exceed the sticky (loyal) user group. Restaurant and food pictures taken by Fantuan’s team are bright and appealing, promotion information is clear and incentivizing and app navigation is simple and easy to follow. More importantly, whereas many US food delivery platforms can only offer their users to rate their experience (ex: out of 5), Fantuan users can leave ratings and actual reviews of their experience for other consumers to reference and for merchants to improve their service quality. Although Fantuan’s services are only offered in Mandarin in most of the company’s locations, it has begun developing and offering an English version of its app in Vancouver this past October, planning to offer services in English in all its other locations in the future.

', 'user': 'Crystal Li' }, ] export default NewsData;
